conclusion: Determine the velocity v of the ions after passing through the velocity selector and the charge-to-mass ratio q/m of the ions selected by the magnetic analyzer.
In the velocity selector, ions experience both electric and magnetic fields.
The electric field E is directed vertically upwards, and the magnetic field B is directed outward perpendicular to the plane of the paper.
The force due to the electric field is F_E = qE.
The force due to the magnetic field is F_B = qvB.
For the ions to pass through the velocity selector undeflected, the electric and magnetic forces must balance: qE = qvB.
Solving for v gives v = E/B.
In the magnetic analyzer, ions follow a circular path due to the magnetic field.
The radius R of the circular path is given by R = mv/(qB).
The ions pass through a quarter-circular ring with inner radius R_1 and outer radius R_2.
The ions that pass through the apertures at the ends of the ring must have a radius R such that R_1 <= R <= R_2.
Using the velocity v from the velocity selector, R = m(E/B)/(qB) = mE/(qB^2).
For the ions to be selected, R must be within the range R_1 to R_2: R_1 <= mE/(qB^2) <= R_2.
Solving for the charge-to-mass ratio q/m gives q/m = E/(B^2 R).
Since R must be between R_1 and R_2, E/(B^2 R_2) <= q/m <= E/(B^2 R_1).
The velocity v of the ions after passing through the velocity selector is v = E/B.
The charge-to-mass ratio q/m of the ions selected by the magnetic analyzer is E/(B^2 R_2) <= q/m <= E/(B^2 R_1).
